title: Ticket #6979: condor_status -af nestedClassAd and condor_status -af:r undefined
description:
$ condor_status -af ToE
[  ]

Is not really OK and could easily cause a crash, instead. 

$ condor_status -af:r undefinedAttribute
undefinedAttribute

This is super not-helpful and TJ has supplied a fix.
remarks:
2019-Apr-04 17:12:49 by tlmiller:
Needs a unit test for the new value type.

2019-Apr-05 13:36:38 by tlmiller:
This is (technically) also an API/semantic change, so this needs to be documented.

2019-May-29 16:27:26 by tlmiller:
Since we don't actually specify the results of -af:r anywhere (after twenty seconds of careful research), I won't document anywhere but the release notes the subtle changes here.
check_ins:
2019-May-29 15:10   Check-in [56984]: (#6979) Version history item. (By Todd L Miller )
2019-Apr-09 17:21   Check-in [56562]: (#6979) Remove potentially-dangling pointers. (By Todd L Miller )
2019-Apr-04 18:02   Check-in [56512]: (#6979) Fix -af:r not printing undefined when attribute reference is undefined. Fix -af not printing a nested classad. (By Todd L Miller )
2019-Apr-04 18:01   Check-in [56511]: (#6979) Fix IsClassAdValue(...) for SCLASSAD_VALUE. (By Todd L Miller )
2019-Apr-04 17:05   Check-in [56509]: (#6979) Add SCLASSAD_VALUE, like SLIST_VALUE, but for nested ClassAds. (So that the value object holds and frees the pointer.) (By Todd L Miller )
creator: tlmiller
